info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 3:54PM PST until January 04 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Continues through Early Tuesday... .A weather system continues to bring snow to the mountains of interior NorCal through early Tuesday. The heaviest snow will occur over the mountains north of Redding into the evening and over Plumas County and the Lassen Park area above 4,000 feet tonight into Tuesday. Lighter snowfall accumulations will impact travel over the Northern Sierra Interstate 80 and Highway 50 tonight into Tuesday. Strong winds will also accompany this weather system and could cause limited visibility at times as well as downed tree branches and weakened trees. The strongest winds will be over Plumas County and eastern Shasta County above 4,000 feet where gusts up to 65+ mph will be possible, causing downed trees and power lines. If you`re planning travel over the mountains early this week, stay in touch with the latest forecasts. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Additional wet snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches, with localized amounts up to 12 inches, are expected. * WHERE...Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County. * WHEN...Until midnight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for wet snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
